result.execSummary:
This case is being appealed. If the court makes a decision in a case that a party disagrees with, the party may have the right to seek review by a higher court to determine if the trial court's decision was correct. Appeals are most often made after a trial or final decision in a case, but an appeal can also occur before a final decision.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: THE DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS SHALL DEDUCT RESTITUTION AND ALL OTHER COURT OBLIGATIONS AT THE RATE OF 25% OF ALL MONIES RECEIVED WHILE INCARCERATED.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay court costs and Department of Corrections Supervision Fees.  If the defendant is discharged from Extended Supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.  Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.

records.descr: Notice of intent to pursue post-conviction relief

records.addlTxt: Temporary Commitment

Defendant Jamaal T. Shellie in court, in custody with attorney jeramiah maynard.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court in session @ 3:10 pm appearances made. Matter before the court for sentencing hearing. Parties are ready to proceed. Record by the court as to the review of file and previous sentencing information in the file. ADA Johnson responds to Court's questions regarding position of the State. State will honor prior agreement to remain silent as to recommendation for sentence. 
3:12 pm. - Atty. Maynard responds to Court's questions regarding transcript of prior hearing. Atty. Maynard has no objection to allowing Deputy Corey Newman to testify, but will rely on the transcript as reflected in transcript. 
3:14 p.m. - State calls Deputy Corey Newman who is duly sworn and responds to questions by ADA Johnson, and provides summary of facts in this case/drug organization, for the Court to consider as to sentencing.
3:30 p.m. - Deputy Newman responds to questions by Atty. Maynard
3:41 p.m. - Witness excused. Defendant's brother, Dure Shellie responds to questions by Atty Maynard and makes a statement to the Court and ask for consideration when sentencing the defendant.
3:45 p.m. - Argument by ADA Johnson
3:57 p.m. - Court in recess to review memorandum filed by Atty. Maynard and for afternoon break.
4:20 p.m. - Court back in session with same appearances. The Court has reviewed the memorandum filed by Atty. Maynard. Argument by Atty. Maynard.
4:33 p.m. - Defendant reads prepared statement/apology to the Court for the record.
4:38 p.m. - Record by the Court as to sentencing factors and his notes on each. Court incorporates all prior remarks from prior sentencing into this record as well. 
Court pronounces sentence as follows:

Count #1 - 7 yrs 6 months Initial Confinement followed by 5 yrs of extended supervision
Count #4 - 7 yrs 6 months Initial Confinement followed by 5 yrs of extended supervision CONSECUTIVE TO COUNT #1
1796 Days of Deadtime Credit
Conditions of Extended Supervision are the same as prior sentencing.
Parties have nothing further.

Court in recess @ 4:47 p.m.
